issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Recent frequent failures have been witnessed in CI, at least 14 instances in the last 6 days.  We have not experienced this in manual cloud deployments as far as I know.

Sampling of CI jobs exhibiting this error:

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos/2521/console - 11/14
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos/2511/console - 11/13
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos/2489/console - 11/13
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos/2473/console - 11/12
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos/2472/console - 11/12

When attempting to set the dasdevice the cookbook shows the following output:


{code:java}
[10.111.5.61] out:     - execute export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=localhost; eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials` &&  //usr/bin/euctl one.storage.blockstoragemanager=das | grep das
[10.111.5.61] out:   * execute[Set das device] action run[2015-11-14T13:27:47-08:00] INFO: Processing execute[Set das device] action run (eucalyptus::configure line 185)
[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:27:47-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[Set das device], 14 attempt(s) left

[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:29:51-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[Set das device], 8 attempt(s) left
[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:30:12-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[Set das device], 7 attempt(s) left
[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:30:32-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[Set das device], 6 attempt(s) left

[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:31:13-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[Set das device], 4 attempt(s) left

[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:32:15-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[Set das device], 1 attempt(s) left
[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:32:35-08:00] INFO: Retrying execution of execute[Set das device], 0 attempt(s) left

[10.111.5.61] out:       command "export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=localhost; eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials` &&  //usr/bin/euctl one.storage.dasdevice=vg01 | grep vg01"

[10.111.5.61] out:     end
[10.111.5.61] out:     
[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:32:56-08:00] INFO: Running queued delayed notifications before re-raising exception
[10.111.5.61] out: 
[10.111.5.61] out: Running handlers:
[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:32:56-08:00] ERROR: Running exception handlers
[10.111.5.61] out: Running handlers complete
[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:32:56-08:00] ERROR: Exception handlers complete
[10.111.5.61] out: [2015-11-14T13:32:56-08:00] FATAL: Stacktrace dumped to /root/.chef/local-mode-cache/cache/chef-stacktrace.out

[10.111.5.61] out: ---- Begin output of export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=localhost; eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials` &&  //usr/bin/euctl one.storage.dasdevice=vg01 | grep vg01 ----

Warning: run() received nonzero return code 1 while executing 'chef-client -z -E mtsugawa-2078 -l info'!

fields.summary: euctl: error (ModifyPropertyValueType): no entities found for property one.storage.dasdevice

comments.body:
[~swathi] and [~zhill], 
Another failure of this type. I'm not sure if we know that it is the same as EUCA-11632 yet.

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/2105/

We now gather logs outside of the test suite so we get logs for all failures. The sos reports for this run are here:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/eutester-test-gather-logs/6245/

[~tony], I see @ http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Calyptos/2593/console

{code}
[10.111.1.178] out:     - execute /usr/sbin/clcadmin-assume-system-credentials | grep -q AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
[10.111.1.178] out:   * ruby_block[Upload cloud keys Chef Server] action run[2015-11-19T01:40:58-08:00] INFO: Processing ruby_block[Upload cloud keys Chef Server] action run (eucalyptus::register-components line 28)
[10.111.1.178] out: [2015-11-19T01:40:58-08:00] INFO: ruby_block[Upload cloud keys Chef Server] called
[10.111.1.178] out: 
[10.111.1.178] out:     - execute the ruby block Upload cloud keys Chef Server
[10.111.1.178] out:   * execute[Register CC] action run[2015-11-19T01:40:58-08:00] INFO: Processing execute[Register CC] action run (eucalyptus::register-components line 50)
[10.111.1.178] out:  (skipped due to not_if)
[10.111.1.178] out:   * execute[Register SC] action run[2015-11-19T01:40:59-08:00] INFO: Processing execute[Register SC] action run (eucalyptus::register-components line 62)
[10.111.1.178] out:  (skipped due to not_if)
{code}

Is it registering the CC and NC? I'm not seeing any execution of registration commands unless those are nested sufficiently in the another cookbook that isn't logging to the console. Could the grep be returning a false positive and steps are skipped?

[~zhill], that shows the skip because they were already registered.
{code}
[10.111.1.178] out:     - execute the ruby block Upload cloud keys Chef Server
[10.111.1.178] out:   * execute[Register CC] action run[2015-11-19T01:17:59-08:00] INFO: Processing execute[Register CC] action run (eucalyptus::register-components line 50)
[10.111.1.178] out: [2015-11-19T01:18:03-08:00] INFO: execute[Register CC] ran successfully
[10.111.1.178] out: 
[10.111.1.178] out:     - execute export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=localhost; eval `clcadmin-assume-system-credentials` &&  //usr/bin/euserv-register-service -t cluster -z one -h 10.111.1.178 one-cc-1
[10.111.1.178] out:   * execute[Register SC] action run[2015-11-19T01:18:03-08:00] INFO: Processing execute[Register SC] action run (eucalyptus::register-components line 62)
[10.111.1.178] out: [2015-11-19T01:18:05-08:00] INFO: execute[Register SC] ran successfully
{code}
[~tony], ack. was that in the same console log? I didn't see any 'register' calls there. Swathi is looking at the logs, but I haven't had a chance to look yet.

Updates from discussions earlier today...
-Below is a snippet showing 'describe services'  from the first test 'synckeys' run in the above job post Calyptos' failure to install.  It looks like the services (SC) were at some point registered during the Calyptos execution. 

-It looks like in cases found so far that the SC and CLC have been co-located on the same machine. Is there any cases where the SC was remote?

-I've attempted 3 manual calyptos installs today on clean machines and using the same env/topology with maint-4.2 as other failing tests in CI. I  have not been able to reproduce this outside of CI. I've been running the latest calyptos on the machine directly and not through Jenkins/CI. This does not occur every time in CI either,  so my manual testing doesn't provide much useful info.  
Thanks, 
-M


{code}

I provisioned a concise regression test with the CC and SC on separate nodes because there was curiosity about that topology.  It's still running regression currently, but the calyptos phase succeeded:

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/2121/
Hi all, any update on this? My understanding is that it looks like Calyptos is doing the right thing and we only see this infrequently and only in CI builds.
[~zhill], this issues hasn't popped up for nearly a week now. We will keep an eye out. The team was working on adding in some debug I am unaware of any other changes though.
This failure has not been seen in several weeks in CI and has not been reproduced manually. I am closing for now. We can reopen if the same issue happens in the future.

I've experienced this again while working on porting the eucalyptus-cookbook to rhel/centos 7. I have a system in this state and will leave it alone for someone to look at. Errors encountered manually are: {code:java} [root@c-40 calyptos]# euctl | grep storage cloud.vmtypes.format_ephemeral_storage = true mycluster1.storage.blockstoragemanager = das mycluster1.storage.cephconfigfile = mycluster1.storage.cephkeyringfile = mycluster1.storage.cephsnapshotpools = mycluster1.storage.cephuser = mycluster1.storage.cephvolumepools = mycluster1.storage.chapuser = mycluster1.storage.dasdevice = ... But here is the service state: {code:java} [root@c-40 calyptos]# euserv-describe-services SERVICE autoscaling API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.autoscaling enabled SERVICE autoscalingbackend eucalyptus 10.111.5.93 enabled SERVICE bootstrap bootstrap 10.111.5.93 enabled SERVICE cloudformation API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.cloudformation enabled SERVICE cloudwatch API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.cloudwatch enabled SERVICE cloudwatchbackend eucalyptus 10.111.5.93 enabled SERVICE cluster mycluster1 mycluster1-cc-1 enabled SERVICE compute API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.compute enabled SERVICE dns API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.dns enabled SERVICE euare API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.euare enabled SERVICE eucalyptus eucalyptus 10.111.5.93 enabled SERVICE identity API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.identity enabled SERVICE imaging API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.imaging enabled SERVICE imagingbackend eucalyptus 10.111.5.93 notready SERVICE jetty eucalyptus 10.111.5.93 enabled SERVICE loadbalancing API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.loadbalancing enabled SERVICE loadbalancingbackend eucalyptus 10.111.5.93 notready SERVICE notifications eucalyptus 10.111.5.93 enabled SERVICE objectstorage API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.objectstorage enabled SERVICE pollednotifications eucalyptus 10.111.5.93 enabled SERVICE reporting bootstrap 10.111.5.93 enabled SERVICE simpleworkflow API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.simpleworkflow enabled SERVICE storage mycluster1 mycluster1-sc-1 notready SERVICE tokens API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111.tokens enabled SERVICE user-api API_10.111.5.111 API_10.111.5.111 enabled SERVICE walrusbackend walrus walrus-1 enabled {code}
I've seen the same problem. Looks like you can't set this property if storage component is in notready state.

Yes, if the SC has not initialized then you cannot configure it yet. A good check in the cookbook is to read the value first and if it is "/dev/blockdev" then init has finished and the value can be set. If you get "<unset>" or "" then init is not complete and the system should wait. These checks must be done after the 'das' value is set to configure the backend for the cluster.

Is that a sufficient workaround? I don't think is removes the need to track this issue, but may unblock QA failures. We will work on a code solution to make it more reliable and speedy as well.
Need to discuss the lifecycle of properties. Agenda for arch meeting.

I am not quite sure why I held on to this ticket for this long. Is this still an accurate description of how dassevice property behaves? I am guessing we may have worked around it in the cookbook, but if a code change is still desirable, I'd like to put this on the storage team's backlog.

We also saw this in Blue Cloud in Sydney with Ceph.  In debugging with Lincoln, we found that setting the mode to overlay, then de-registering, then re-registering the SC solved the issue.  The issue never occurred on the second SC.

Please note this was 4.2.1 and we have not seen it in 4.4.
No fix has been submitted, will close this issue.
This issue is being closed and work is being done in such issues as EUCA-13287, EUCA-13312, etc.  Refer to those issues for status.
